entry.title: The Value of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in The Context of Business Steering
entry.content:
This blog post is a joint work of @Nektarios_Vasileiou33 and @BlazZabukovec .

Picture 1: SAP Analytics Cloud demo story example - Dashboard design by Daniel Davis

 

MOTIVATION

In today's fast-paced business world, the ability to effectively steer and lead an organisation is fundamental for achieving strategic goals and maintaining a competitive edge. A key success criterion is the capacity to fully harness and derive value from organisational data. Many companies struggle with data problems, such as fragmented information, outdated systems, and the super important task of preparing data for emerging technologies like AI. Recognising these challenges, we are excited to introduce a blog series dedicated to showcasing the substantial business value of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in the context of planning and analytics.

The motivation behind this initiative is to provide a comprehensive exploration of how SAP BDC capabilities as essential instruments, facilitating robust strategic alignment and guiding effective decision-making processes across diverse organisational requirements. We aim to illustrate how SAP BDC, equipped with powerful data management, planning, analytics and innovative AI capabilities, empowers organisations with enhanced business steering agility by providing real-time insights, streamlined data management, and automated decision support â€“ going from insights to action, helps mainly leaders guide their businesses with precision.

Our blog series will provide valuable insights for decision-makers seeking to harness SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) to enhance operational efficiency, optimise resource allocation, and achieve long-term objectives. By featuring detailed planning & analytics topics, the series will illustrate the transformative impact of SAP BDC in addressing the operational complexities of todayâ€™s business environment. This first introductory blog post will spotlight the strategic advantages of SAP BDC, particularly in the context of Business Steering, setting the stage for a deeper exploration of its benefits throughout the blog series.

There are several blog posts in the series that will cover advantages of SAP BDC in the context of business steering, so please stay tuned for the upcoming blogs:

  1. The value of SAP BDC in the context of business steering (THIS BLOG POST)

  2. Is AI going to â€œretireâ€ a dashboard?

  3. Simulations, a game changer in todayâ€™s volatile world

  4. Planning & Analysis in the context of SAP BDC

  5. Move BPC and BW-IP into SAP BDC

  6. Real-time steering with LIVE planning

  7. PaPM use cases

  8. Self â€“ service analytics and real time business steering

  9. Business steering powered by AI agents

  10. Leverage data products in the context of planning & forecasting

  11. Introducing AI/ML capabilities by SAP Databricks

 

CHALLENGES

The current global market situation is characterised by heightened volatility and uncertainty, driven by factors such as geopolitical tensions, inflationary pressures and rapid technological advancements. In this dynamic environment businesses face significant challenges like supply chain disruptions, rising and uncontrolled operational costs and the need for digital transformation to remain competitive.

Obviously, there is no one-size-fits-all solution to every challenge, but adopting a data-driven decision-making process provides significant advantages that can help organizations navigate complexities and respond more effectively to market dynamics. By relying on data to drive decisions, businesses can achieve greater accuracy and insight, which helps in identifying trends, understanding customer behaviours, and optimising operations. This approach enables companies to be more agile and responsive to changing conditions.

Every leader today feels the weight of growing complexity. CFOs balancing growth and profitability. CHROs managing talent in an evolving workforce. CIOs modernising IT while keeping innovation alive.

Picture 2: Challenges by CXO persona

But the true challenge lies in how these functions are increasingly interconnected. When one part of the business is disrupted, whether itâ€™s a supply chain issue or a talent gap, the ripple effects are felt everywhere. To succeed, businesses need more than solutions for individual challenges, businesses need a way to align every function and unlock collective power.

Like Aristotle (apparently) once said: â€œTHE WHOLE IS GREATER THAN THE SUM OF ITS PARTSâ€

Todayâ€™s complexity demands more than incremental fixes and silo apps/solutions. If we want to have benefits from AI and systems of agents collaborating across all functions, we need to have a solid foundation, where we can seamlessly combine applications, data, insights and AI into one ecosystem.

Just picture this example around Financial Planning (incl. forecasting & simulation), where we can develop a comprehensive financial snapshot while automating workflow tasks through agentic AI.

Picture 3: Forecasting & Simulation use case evolution

This is where we bring together all relevant data, like revenues, expenses, also across different scenarios, like actuals, plan & forecast. We also integrate all relevant external data, like different macro-economic KPIs, external market research data., etc. Based on identified key drivers/influencers of our business, we are going to define and perform different planning/forecasting scenarios. In the next step we are going to simulate and analyse impact of external drivers like inflation rate on our performance and identify the areas that will be impacted. Specialised analytics agent can propose potential mitigation strategies, like targeted promotions to drive customer demand, that can be further assessed & analysed. Based on this information we can decide for a certain course of actions that can be triggered by system of agents.

Picture 4: Risk analysis & mitigation strategies delivered by agentic AI

We can say with great confidence that our customers are not working in the area of visualising their data and thatâ€™s why SAP is also not in the business of visualising our customerâ€™s data (even though we can do this is in a great way), but we are in a business of enabling the â€œInsights to Actionâ€ framework which is exactly what I have illustrated in the use case around financial planning powered by agentic AI.

Organizations striving to make data-driven decisions and a proper, also AI powered jump from insights to action, encounter several significant challenges. One major obstacle is seamlessly integrating data across various systems to extract valuable business insights. Additionally, ensuring data quality and integrity is crucial to maintaining trust in the decision-making process. Furthermore, building a comprehensive data foundation is essential for supporting the deployment of AI-based applications. Addressing these challenges requires robust data management strategies and innovative solutions to harness the full potential of data for valuable decision-making.

 

SAP's STRATEGY

To tackle these challenges, SAP developed the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) to provide cloud services that empower organizations in navigating the complexities of data management and business steering process. SAP BDC serves as a unified platform, providing the necessary agility for effective business steering. SAP BDC offers a semantically rich, unified data environment that enhances operational efficiency and strategic decision-making capabilities. By centralising key business data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer, SAP BDC unlocks insights, advanced analytics, and AI capabilities, empowering businesses to drive intelligent growth and innovation.

Picture 5: SAP Business Suite

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) is a fully managed Software as a Service (SaaS) solution that unifies and governs all SAP data while seamlessly connecting with third-party data. The solution combines the capabilities of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Business Warehouse, along with managed SAP Databricks. SAP BDC includes curated business-ready data products from SAP line of business applications leveraged by business-ready Intelligent Applications providing line-of-business leaders the context needed to make impactful decisions.

Picture 6: High level overview of SAP BDC services

Key Components of SAP Business Data Cloud:

SAP Datasphere: As the foundational element of SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Datasphere provides a streamlined environment for data integration, warehousing, and governance. It features flexible integrated data tieringâ€”comprising object, disk-based, and in-memory storageâ€”ensuring a cost-effective persistence layer. Additionally, it offers sophisticated tools for analytical data modeling, transformation, and integration, enabling organizations to extract valuable insights and foster business innovation. Users can also utilize the framework to develop their own data products.

SAP Analytics Cloud: This component delivers cutting-edge analytics and planning capabilities while providing real-time insights powered by AI and machine learning. It integrates seamlessly with SAP Datasphere to offer a unified data analysis experience.

SAP Databricks: Through SAP's partnership with Databricks, data science capabilities are significantly enhanced. This collaboration facilitates advanced analytics and data science operations on both SAP and non-SAP data. Key features include ML Flows for machine learning operations, Mosaic AI for model training and serving, and Notebooks equipped with coding assistants and visualizations. The serverless Spark offerings aim to simplify big data processing, while replication-free access to SAP data products and integration with the Unity Catalogue further enrich the experience.

Intelligent Applications and Data Products: SAP Business Data Cloud emphasizes Intelligent Applications and SAP-managed Data Products. These ready-to-use, standardized business data objects and applications are managed by SAP, reducing the effort needed to build and operate analytical and data science applications. They promote data consistency and reusability, serving as modular, reusable assets for analytical models or AI/ML and planning workflows.

Unified Semantic Layer: Central to SAP Business Data Cloud is the unified semantic model, which standardizes data definitions across SAP and non-SAP systems. It offers simplified zero-copy data access via a standardized delta-share interface, supporting cross-domain analytics and AI applications. Additionally, it features a centralized cross-application catalog for data products and Intelligent Applications.

SAP BW: is integrated into SAP BDC, allowing SAP BW objects to be onboarded as data products. The SAP BW data products can be integrated in SAP Databricks to enable advanced analytics and data science use cases.

 

BUSINESS VALUE

SAP BDC delivers significant business value in the context of business steering, particularly within planning and analytics use cases. 

Enhanced Decision-Making: SAP BDC revolutionises decision-making by providing real-time access to integrated data. This SAP Analytics Cloud capability ensures that business leaders receive accurate and immediate insights, empowering them to make informed and strategic decisions. With this enhanced decision-making capacity, organizations can effectively anticipate market trends, adjust their strategies in response to evolving conditions, and maintain a competitive edge in their respective industries.

Comprehensive Data Integration: At the heart of SAP BDC is its ability to seamlessly integrate data from multiple sources, both SAP and non-SAP systems. This integration creates a unified view of the organisation's data landscape, supporting precise planning and predictive forecasting. By breaking down data silos and ensuring a holistic perspective, SAP BDC enables businesses to gain comprehensive insights into their operations and make well-rounded decisions. The data holistic perspective is fundamental for organizations to unleash AI across the entire data ecosystem.

Scalable Analytics and Planning Capabilities: One of the standout features of SAP BDC is its scalable analytics and planning capabilities. It allows businesses to conduct extensive analyses and simulations, uncovering valuable insights that aid in tailoring forecasts to specific scenarios. Whether it's understanding customer behavior or predicting market shifts, SAP Analytics Cloud robust analytics and planning capabilities in combination with SAP Databricks empower organizations to make data-driven predictions with unmatched precision and confidence.

Improved Efficiency and Agility: SAP BDC streamlines data integration and analytics processes, significantly enhancing efficiency and agility within organizations. By automating these crucial processes, leveraging data management features in SAP Datasphere, analytics in SAP Analytics Cloud and AI/ML workflows in SAP Databricks, it cuts down the time and effort needed for data preparation and analysis (replication free access of data and zero-copy). This efficiency allows teams to redirect their focus from operational concerns to strategic steering, driving more meaningful business results in less time.

Facilitated Innovation: Leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning, SAP BDC promotes innovation within organizations. Its cloud-based infrastructure ensures that businesses have access to the latest advancements, encouraging the exploration of new and innovative business models. This focus on facilitated innovation helps companies remain at the forefront of industry trends and continuously evolve their offerings.

Consistency in Data Governance: Ensuring data integrity and consistency is a critical component of SAP BDC's value proposition. The platform offers comprehensive data governance and quality management, providing reliable data integrity across planning and analytics activities. With consistent data definitions and governance, businesses can achieve accurate reporting and foster alignment across various departments, leading to cohesive planning strategies.

Seamless Collaboration: SAP BDC enhances collaboration by centralising data accessibility and sharing. Data Cataloguing, Data Sharing and Collaboration capabilities foster improved teamwork among departments and enables synchronised planning efforts and a guided steering process. With shared insights and aligned goals, teams can work together more effectively, driving unified strategies and achieving common objectives that benefit the entire organisation.

Strategic Resource Allocation: Through its predictive analytics and planning capabilities SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Databricks, SAP BDC enables organizations to allocate resources more strategically. By delivering actionable insights, businesses can optimize operations, improve resource allocation, and enhance overall performance. This strategic approach ensures that resources are used efficiently to achieve maximum impact, driving profound business success.

Future-Proofing Autonomous Business Steering: By harnessing SAP AI agents within the trusted SAP BDC data foundation, the planning and business steering process is transformed from a static, periodic exercise into a dynamic, proactive function. These AI-driven insights empower companies to swiftly assess the potential impacts of various strategic options and make decisive actions. This approach allows businesses to anticipate market changes and respond efficiently, making strategic adjustments with confidence and precision.

 

CONCLUSION

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) stands as a vital tool for organisations striving to enhance their decision-making capabilities, align strategic objectives, and navigate the complexities of modern business landscapes. In the era of AI, organizations require scalable and efficient data architectures to manage growing volumes of data and extract actionable insights leveraging advanced analytics, planning and machine learning capabilities. As we embark on this informative blog series, we invite you to stay tuned for our upcoming posts, where we will delve deeper into the AI, Planning & Analytics functionalities associated with SAP BDC and business steering use cases. Gain insights into how this powerful platform can drive your business forward, optimise operations, and help you achieve your strategic goals with confidence. Join us in exploring the transformative potential of SAP BDC and discover how it can be the catalyst for your organisation's growth and success.

 

CALL TO ACTION

To deepen your understanding of SAP Business Data Cloud, we invite you to explore the following links:

SAP Business Data Cloud Help

https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud?locale=en-US

Introducing SAP Business Data Cloud

https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/leveraging-sap-analytics-cloud-functionality-for-enterprise-planning/introducing-sap-business-data-cloud

Positioning SAP Business Data Cloud

https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/positioning-sap-business-data-cloud-1

entry.title: Ready-to-Use Template Dashboards: Integrating SAP Cloud ALM Data into SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello and welcome! In this blog, I'm excited to share the progress I've made on creating easy-to-use dashboards with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) using data from SAP Cloud ALM (CALM) Health Monitoring (HM) and Real User Monitoring (RUM). Let's see how these dashboards can turn data into helpful insights.

The Project Overview
In today's dynamic business landscape, making informed decisions requires access to accurate and timely data. That's precisely what my dashboards aim to achieve: providing a user-friendly interface to visualize and analyze SAP system data.
The project entails building two dashboards that provide comprehensive insights into system health and user interactions. We can import these pre-built templates into your SAC environment, connect them with your CALM data, and provide you with immediate access to system and service information, saving you the effort of creating dashboards from scratch.

Dashboard Highlights

  • Health Analytics Dashboard
    Built for S/4HANA systems, this dashboard provides insights into system health and performance, helping identify issues through data on uptime and resource utilization.
    Here the details of the dimensions available through the API: Health Monitoring Analytics API | SAP Help Portal

      

  • Real User Analytics Dashboard
    This dashboard tracks user interactions. It reveals activity patterns, identifies bottlenecks, and highlights areas for improvement in your digital environment.
    Here the details of the dimensions available through the API: Real User Monitoring Requests Type Analytics API | SAP Help Portal


Key Benefits

  • Plug-and-Play Templates:
    We can import these dashboards into your SAC tenant and connect them with your existing CALM setup. This service removes the need for you to design dashboards on your own and offers an immediate starting point for analysis.
  • Customization Flexibility:
    While the templates offer a comprehensive initial setup, users have the freedom to modify and expand upon these dashboards to better align with their specific needs. This adaptability ensures that the dashboards remain relevant and scalable.
  • Historical Data Analysis:
    The dashboards can display data for specific points in timeâ€”such as days or hoursâ€”as well as over a selected period, but depending on the chart. The configuration I would recommend would be to set up daily updates, gathering the data of the previous day, every morning. Then this setup will continuously enriches your model with new data.

Conclusion
This SAP Analytics Cloud project exemplifies the powerful intersection of data and technology. By providing these ready-to-use dashboards, I aim to facilitate a starting point for users seeking to utilize their SAP Cloud ALM data effectively. The dashboards not only simplify the analytical journey but act as a catalyst for data-driven decision-making.
If there are other metrics or areas you believe could benefit from similar dashboards, I'd love to hear your ideas. Your suggestions could guide future dashboard developments  ğŸ™‚


Don't hesitate to reach out to your SAP representative to see how SAP can support you regarding these ready-to-use dashboards.


Thank you for taking the time to read my post.

entry.title: CSS in SAC - Borders & Shadows a quick guide to css syntax
entry.content:
This blog post provides a quick run through of the various border and shadow effects you can apply with CSS in SAC,
the examples given are based on the panel widget.

SAC CSS Engine
In SAC, the CSS engine expects explicitly defined styles, especially for compound shorthand properties like border, border-top, etc.
SAC requires all 3 properties to be set e.g. for a border:     border: [width] [style] [color];
e.g.

Outer & Inner CSS Classes
When you open the CSS menu and select any Widget from the dropdown menu, SAC will always show
the â€˜Widget CSS Classâ€™ options.
This is the outer class for the widget, below this you will then see the widget specific inner class.

Outer class

Widget specific inner class (button in this example)

 

Styles
The CSS help / example for each Widget type doesnâ€™t specify supported styles
e.g. For a panel widget it simply lists the supported classes â€“ background-color, border etc.

 

It takes a bit of trial and error to find which styles work for each class & widget combination.
e.g. for borders:

Undocumented Style Parameters:
border: double
border: groove
border: ridge
border: solid
border: dashed
border: dotted

Colours

When assigning colours via a CSS class we can use
RGB                                   - Red, Green, Blue
RGBA                                 - Red, Green, Blue, Alpha (opacity)
HEX                                    - Hexadecimal
Basic Colour typed       - red , blue , orange etc.

RGB  or HEX is used when we only want to apply a solid colour e.g.
Red
rgb: 255,0,0     /     hex: #FF0000

RGB 
Each parameter (red, green, and blue) defines the intensity of the color between 0 and 255.
For example, rgb(255, 0, 0) is displayed as red, because red is set to its highest value (255) and the others are set to 0.

To display black, set all color parameters to 0, like this: rgb(0, 0, 0).
To display white, set all color parameters to 255, like this: rgb(255, 255, 255).

RGBA
Is used when we want to define colour & opacity, the Alpha (A) value can be between 0 &1
e.g.  rgba(255,0,0,0.2) sets the opacity to 20% 

Borders

Documented Properties:  (listed in the SAC CSS menu)
border, border-top, border-right, border-bottom, border-left, opacity
*        Descendants: N/A;
*        Pseudos: N/A;

Undocumented Style Parameters:
border: double
border: groove
border: ridge
border: solid
border: dashed
border: dotted

Border Examples

Solid border

.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 6px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);  }
/* Solid black border, 6px wide all-round the widget

Applies a solid border to a widget 

Top Border
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border-top: 6px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);  }         

Bottom Border
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border-bottom: 6px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);  }

Left Border
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border-left: 6px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);  }

Right Border
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border-right: 6px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);  }

 

Double lined border
Applies a double border to a widget.                                                     
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 6px double rgba(34, 54, 73, 0.5);  }

Groove border
Applies a groove style border to a widget.
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 10px groove rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);  }          

Ridge border
Applies a ridge style border to a widget.                                                     
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 10px ridge rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);  }

Dotted border
Applies a dotted style border to a widget.    
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 10px dotted rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);  }                                             

Dashed border
Applies a dashed style border to a widget.    
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
      border: 10px dashed rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);  }                                        


Multi coloured borders
Applies colour to top and bottom 20px wide borders.   
.my-css-class.sap-custom-panel-widget {
    border-top:    20px solid rgba(255, 201, 51, 0.9);
    border-bottom: 20px solid red;   }         

Apply multiple border styles in a CSS class
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
border-top:4px solid #FFC933;
border-right: 4px dashed #CCC;
border-bottom: 4px dotted rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
border-left: 4px solid rgb(100, 100, 255);      }


Note how we are able to mix and match border styles, we can also interchangeably use RGB , RGBA & HEX for the colour coding.

 

Shadow
Documented Properties:  (listed in the SAC CSS menu)
box-shadow
*        Descendants: N/A;
*        Pseudos: N/A;
Undocumented Properties:
inset

Box Shadow
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget { box-shadow: 5px 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3); }

Explanation
box-shadow adds a shadow effect around the elementâ€™s box.
5px 5px â†’ the horizontal and vertical offset of the shadow.
10px â†’ the blur radius (how soft or sharp the shadow is).
rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3) â†’ the color of the shadow: black (0,0,0) with 30% transparency.

Have a play with the parameters, for example set the offset values to -5px   and the shadow will appear on the left and top of the widget.
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget { box-shadow: ---5px -5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3); }



Inset Box Shadow
.my-css-class.sap-custom-panel-widget { box-shadow: inset 5px 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3); }

Stacked Inset Shadow
Combines inset shadow with an outer shadow, making the panel appear raised but with an inner depth.                
.my-css-class.sap-custom-panel-widget {
    box-shadow: inset 5px 5px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3),
                                            8px 8px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);  }

One-Sided Inset Shadow
Creates a shadow only on the left inner side of the panel.      
.my-css-class.sap-custom-panel-widget {
    box-shadow: inset 10px 0px 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3); }

Multiple Shadows
Combines inset shadow with an outer shadow,
making the panel appear raised but with an inner depth.
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget { 
        box-shadow:
               inset 3px 3px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3),
               inset -3px -3px 8px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2); }                

Hard Edged Shadow
To create a solid, cut-out like effect, set the blur radius (third value) to 0px.    
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {    box-shadow: inset 5px 5px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); }

Opacity â€“ Box Shadow Combo
Set the panel opacity to 85% and apply a box shadow     
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {   
          opacity: 0.85;
          box-shadow: inset 0px 0px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);  }            

Glow Effect Shadow
Applies a coloured glow effect border to a panel.                                  
.my-css-class .sap-custom-panel-widget {
        box-shadow:
        0px 0px 15px rgba(0, 255, 255, 0.6);  }   /* Cyan glow */

entry.title: ChatGPT Meets SAP Analytics Cloud: A Developerâ€™s Guide to ChatGPT Custom Widget
entry.content:
SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a powerful platform for data analytics, planning, and predictive insights. Enhancing SAC with AI-driven conversational capabilities can significantly improve user interaction and data exploration. The ChatGPT Custom Widget for SAC enables seamless integration of OpenAI's ChatGPT chat box directly into your SAC stories and analytic applications, providing a flexible, fast, and customizable chat interface. This blog walks you through the features, installation, and usage of the ChatGPT Custom Widget, empowering you to leverage AI-powered conversational analytics within SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

What is the ChatGPT Custom Widget for SAC?

The ChatGPT Custom Widget is a ready-to-use component that embeds a ChatGPT-powered chat box inside your SAC environment. It allows users to interact with data and analytics through natural language queries, enhancing the decision-making process with AI-generated insights.

ğŸ“¥Download Links: ChatGPT Custom Widget: https://sap-custom-widget.rohitchouhan.com/?dl=ChatGPT
ğŸ”—GitHub Repository: https://github.com/SAP-Custom-Widget/ChatGPT
ğŸ“šDocumentation: chatgpt-custom-widget-documentation.pdf 

Key Features and Capabilities:

  • 100% Free to Use (needs OpenAI API key)
  • Modern Chat Interface: WhatsApp/Messenger-style design
  • Multiple AI Models: GPT-3.5-turbo, GPT-4, GPT-4-turbo support
  • Advanced Parameters: Temperature (0-2), max tokens (1-4096), response choices (1-10)
  • Custom Styling: Colors, fonts, sizes, themes
  • Real-time Responses: Streaming text generation
  • Export Chat:  Conversation export
  • Error Handling: Built-in API error management
  • Auto-updates: Widget version notifications
  • Mobile Responsive: Works on tablets and phones

Installation Guide

Follow these simple steps to add the ChatGPT Custom Widget to your SAP Analytics Cloud environment:

  1. Download the Widget JSON File
    Obtain the ChatGPT.json file from the official GitHub repository or the provided link.
  2. Access SAC Custom Widgets
    Log in to your SAC portal. Navigate to Stories from the left sidebar, then select the Custom Widget tab.
  3. Upload the Widget
    Click the + icon on the right side and upload the downloaded ChatGPT.json file.
  4. Ready to Use
    The widget is now available for use in your SAC stories and analytic applications.

Complete Guidance and Tutorial Video

If you want to see how to use and install what are the feature, please follow this video to know it better.

Configuration and Usage

  1. Get OpenAI API Key
    Visit platform.openai.com â†’ Sign up/Login â†’ Go to API Keys â†’ Create new key â†’ Copy and save securely
  2. Add Widget to Story
    Open your SAC story â†’ Insert â†’ Custom Widget â†’ Select "ChatGPT Widget" â†’ Drag to canvas
  3. Configure API Settings
    Designer Panel â†’ Builder â†’ API Configuration:
    • API Key: Paste your OpenAI key
    • Model: Choose gpt-3.5-turbo (fast, cheap) or gpt-4 (better quality)
    • Temperature: 0.1 (focused) to 1.5 (creative)
    • Max Tokens: 150-2048 (response length)
    • System Message: Set AI behavior and context
  4. Customize Appearance
    Design tab â†’  Styles, header text
  5. Test and Deploy
    Preview mode â†’ Test chat functionality â†’ Save story â†’ Share with users

Advanced Use Cases and Applications

Business Intelligence Applications:

  • Data Exploration: "Show me sales trends for Q4" or "What are the top performing products?"
  • Report Generation: Auto-create executive summaries from dashboard data
  • Anomaly Detection: Ask AI to identify unusual patterns in data
  • KPI Analysis: Get explanations for metric changes and recommendations

Industry-Specific Applications:

  • Customer Service: Automate FAQ responses, provide product recommendations, handle basic inquiries
  • Sales & Marketing: Lead qualification, campaign analysis, customer segmentation insights
  • Finance: Budget variance analysis, financial report explanations, cost optimization suggestions
  • Operations: Process optimization, resource allocation, performance monitoring
  • HR Analytics: Employee satisfaction analysis, recruitment insights, performance reviews

Integrating ChatGPT with SAC transforms your analytics environment into an interactive, AI-powered assistant that enhances productivity and decision-making.

Security Considerations:

  • API Key Protection: Never share or hardcode API keys
  • Data Privacy: Be cautious with sensitive business data in prompts
  • Rate Limiting: Monitor API usage to avoid quota limits
  • Access Control: Restrict widget access to authorized users only
  • Regular Updates: Keep widget updated for security patches

Conclusion

The ChatGPT Custom Widget for SAP Analytics Cloud is a game-changer for organizations looking to infuse AI-driven conversational intelligence into their analytics workflows. With easy installation, flexible customization, and powerful OpenAI integration, this widget empowers users to interact naturally with their data and unlock deeper insights.

Get started today by downloading the widget, setting up your OpenAI API key, and embedding the chat box into your SAC stories. Experience the future of analytics with ChatGPT and SAP Analytics Cloud!

If you want to explore the widget further or contribute, check out the GitHub repository maintained by the developer Rohit Chouhan.

entry.title: How to Design Low-Fidelity Dashboards with the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Schematics UI Kit
entry.content:
Focus of this blog:

  • Intro
  • How the library is set up
  • How to get the library
  • How to use the library
  • How to work efficiently with the library
  • Essential Ressources

 

Intro

Effective dashboard design begins with user research. Gathering and understanding the necessary insights of your end-users' needs and requirements ensures high-quality experience. Jumping straight into creating high-fidelity mockups or even building dashboards directly in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories can create unnecessary distraction and slow down your design process.

ğŸ‘‰  Learn how to build better dashboards here.

Instead, start with scribbles and rough sketches. Early in the process, low-fidelity mockups help you explore ideas quickly, collect feedback, and align on structure and meaningful insights before refining visual details.

Thatâ€™s why we created the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Schematics UI Kit for Figma. It helps you transform your ideas seamlessly into digital low-fidelity designs.

The library offers basic layouts and provides components to help you design and iterate quickly, without distraction, ensuring you can focus on what matters: content, flow, and meaningful Insights. It helps you to speed up your design process, share clear ideas, review them with your team, and get feedback from stakeholders.

 

 

How the library is set up

The library consists of three pages, which allows for easy navigation and usage.

The first page, â€œğŸ““ Coverâ€œ, is a library overview that includes a cover, a version history and slides explaining the purpose and usage of the library.

Cover page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Schematics UI Kit

 

The second page, â€œâœï¸ Analytical Pagesâ€, provides dashboard templates. Depending on the purpose of your dashboard, you can choose to use different BI page types, or start with an empty page to design your dashboard from scratch.

Second page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Schematics UI Kit

 

The third page, â€œâœï¸ Componentsâ€, contains all other assets: UI elements and controls, containers and different chart types available in SAP Analytics Cloud stories.

Third page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Schematics UI Kit

 

 

How to get the library

You can easily download the library from GitHub and import it into Figma.

ğŸ‘‰  Navigate to the SAC Fiori Horizon Theme folder on GitHub.

Open the file "External_SAC_Dashboard_Schematics_UI_Kit.fig".

Overview of our GitHub folder structure

Click the Download button to save the file.

Placement of the download button on GitHub

Open the downloaded file in Figma. Choose a destination folder, and you're ready to go.

Overview of the import dialogs in Figma

 

 

How to use the library

We recommend publishing the library internally in your company's Figma space after importing the file to make use of Figmaâ€™s Library functionality. This means, that based on your settings, your direct team or your whole organization can access the library through the asset panel, enabling smooth collaboration and consistent usage across your design teams.

To publish a library, open the File Settings, navigate to â€œLibraryâ€ and click on â€œPublish Library...â€. Select the components you want to publish and specify who can access the library. Click on "Publish" and it's done.

Note: This option won't work if the file has been imported into your Drafts.

File options dropdown menu in Figma

 

Now you can add the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Schematics UI Kit to your files through the libraries dialog and access all components directly from the assets panel.

If you donâ€™t want to publish the library internally, you can simply copy and paste the components into your own design files or use them as local assets.

 

 

How to work efficiently with the library

To get started, weâ€™ve created a short introduction video that demonstrates how to build a dashboard using the library.

 

 

You can follow one of two possible workflows:

1. Start with an analytical page type

Open a new file and navigate to the assets panel. Drag an instance into your canvas, e.g. a "Monitoring Page".

In the design panel, you can see the different options you have for each instance. The "Monitoring Page" can use the visual type â€œPlaceholderâ€ (default) or â€œContentâ€. Switching to â€œContentâ€ will present basic charts.

Screenshot of the "Monitoring Page" with the "Visual Type" option set to "Placeholder".

 

Most components are nested within each other. This means you can simply select individual parts of an instance to get additional options in the design panel. This makes it easy to adjust the layout to fit your specific needs.

Screenshot of the "Sticky Header" instance in Figma, with its editable options visible in the design panel.

 

 

2. Start from scratch

Open a new file and either create a new frame or navigate to the assets panel to drag an "Empty Page" into your canvas. If you use the "Empty Page", you can detach the instance to freely use and customize the frame.

Screenshot of the "Empty Page" in Figma with the context menu open and the cursor hovering over the "Detach instance" option.

 

Browse or search for the containers you want to use, e.g. a header and multiple panels or cards, and drag them into your frame.

Screenshot of a new dashboard layout in Figma with one panel selected, showing its editable options in the design panel.

 

Set "Visual Type" to â€œContentâ€ to show charts.

Screenshot of a dashboard with the "Visual Type" menu open and the cursor hovering over the "Content" option.

 

 

 

Feel free to share any feedback, ideas, questions, or requests regarding our SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Schematics UI Kit in the comments below.

And check out our Dashboard Design Best-Practices blog series that was created to assist you in designing and building meaningful dashboards with SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

Essential Ressources

SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Schematics UI Kit 

SAC Fiori Horizon Theme folder on GitHub

"Build Better Dashboards" - Process

Dashboard Design Best-Practices

entry.title: 2025 Q3 SAP Analytics Cloud compass Highlights
entry.content:
In the coming QRC3 release, compass users will be seeing two new features which will ease risk analysis further for end users: Relative range input and conflict driver detection.

Relative Range Input

Compass users will be able to enter their assumption for driver uncertainties as relative values, i.e. as offsets to the current baseline in the model. The offsets could be entered as percentage or numbers.  During input, a display below the input will show the converted absolute value for immediate visual validation.
Entering driver uncertainties as offsets will allow the capturing of assumptions which is more aligned with the business language, and also an easy application of the same effect (e.g. +5%) across different drivers. 
Another cool detail: Publishing a scenario will convert the relative inputs into absolute values for the public scenario, but once a private copy is create from this result, the input will be converted back into the relative ranges again. This is to respect the different needs between result consumption (public scenario) and scenario modelling (private scenario). 

Conflict Driver Detection

Scenario modelling is a very volatile process, and usually users are capturing their assumptions at the speed of their thoughts. During such a process it might at times lead to them creating conflicting drivers unintentionally, such as setting up driver uncertainties for overlapping drivers. An example could e.g. setting up uncertainties for revenue in Europe and Germany at the same time for the same scenario run (Germany is part of Europe, hence the overlap). In such cases, compass will indicate the conflict, assisting users to maintain a leaner and cleaner driver list with valid configurations. 

With these two new features we hope to boost the efficiency of scenario modelling for end users, making risk analysis even more approachable for business users. 
New to compass? Take a look at these blogs:

    • Introduction to Monte Carlo Simulation
    • General Release of SAP Analytics Cloud compass
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART I)
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART II)
